intro: Bernardina, commonly known as the "flower of the dead," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Boraginaceae. It is native to South America, particularly the Andes region, and is characterized by its striking, violet-colored flowers. The plants typically grow in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. They are herbaceous perennials with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The genus includes several species, such as Bernardina elata, which is noted for its ornamental value and unique floral structure.
